description: Rufus Woods Lake is a reservoir located on the upper Columbia River between Chief Joseph and Grand Coulee dams (river km 877 and 960 respectively). It supports a robust trout fishery that is currently maintained by stocking efforts of the Colville Tribes Resident Fish Hatchery. The goal of the Rufus Woods Fisheries Evaluation Project (formerly titled “Rufus Woods Habitat/Passage Improvement, Creel and Triploid Supplementation”) and this creel survey is to provide fisheries managers with information that assists with the development and maintenance of a subsistence fishery for Colville Confederated Tribes tribal members and a quality sport fishery for members and non-members while conserving native species. The CCT utilizes this reservoir wide creel survey to assist with the development of stocking strategies and to inform adaptive management of the fishery.

areasOfInferences.areaDisplayName: Chief Joseph Dam to Grand Coulee Dam

title: Rufus Woods Creel Sampling - Colville Confederated Tribes V2.0
